newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo naphtha lower on crude, traders sidelined.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo naphtha lower on crude, traders sidelined.

text.p: Naphtha prices slipped on Wednesday in a quiet market where cautious traders were sidelined waiting for the opening of overseas crude markets for some clue of market direction.
"I think the (overseas) crude drop has made people a little bit nervous," one trader said.
"But, I still think there will be more selling than buying," he added.
First-half October open-spec naphtha was assessed bid at $195 and offered at $196. Second-half October was assessed bid and offered at $193.75/195.0.
First-half November was notionally assessed bid around $193.0 to $193.25 and offered at around $194.0 to $194.25.
A second-half October was traded overnight at $195.5, while a first-half October was rumoured done at $196.
Naphtha end-users have mostly covered their requirements for September, traders said.
They now appear to have shifted their attention to their requirements for October, which would include their needs to meet winter demand for heating fuel. traders said.
